title: Natural-Gas Prices Rise, Defying Seasonal Trends
sub_head: Futures climb 4.3% in the latest sign of persistent demand, driven in part by disruptions overseas
body:
Natural-gas prices extended their climb Thursday, bucking seasonal trends as demand from overseas continues to pressure inventories.
U.S. natural-gas futures for May delivery rose 4.3% Thursday to $7.3000 per million British thermal units—a 96% rise in the year to date. While natural gas stockpiles rose modestly during the week ended April 8, they remain nearly 25% below last year’s levels and 18% below the five-year average for this time of year, according to data released Thursday by the U.S. Energy Information Administration.
